title: Helena Castle
opening: At long last, Altea was free again. Marth took the League to Helena Castle in the north, an old fortress and key supply point during Dolhr and Grust’s occupation. There he meant to seize the last of the enemy’s gold and provisions but Grust would not give up the castle without a fight...

intro.speaker: Enemy Soldier
intro.line: Lord Dactyl, I’ve brought the mage.

intro.speaker: Dactyl
intro.line: Well, then? Have you been persuaded to fight for us?

intro.speaker: Dactyl
intro.line: You’d rather DIE? Ha! As if a spell-slinging vagabond like you has any choice in the matter! Enough. Strip him of all his possessions and lock him up someplace. Perhaps we can use him later.

intro.speaker: Enemy Soldier
intro.line: There’s not much to strip him of, milord. Just the tome and this ring...

intro.speaker: Dactyl
intro.line: Ring? Let me have a look at that.

intro.speaker: Etzel
intro.line: No! Don’t you- Grr, let me go! Don’t you touch Ursula’s ring!

intro.speaker: Enemy Soldier
intro.line: O-oi! Take your hands off Lord Dactyl!

intro.speaker: Etzel
intro.line: Rrgh... please, not the ring! ...Give it BACK!

intro.speaker: Dactyl
intro.line: Hmph, all that for some tawdry ring. ...Hmm? That gives me an idea...

battle.speaker: Dactyl
battle.line: Good. I’ve had a change of heart. I am considering giving that ring of yours back.

battle.speaker: Dactyl
battle.line: BUT...you must face the League for us. How much considering I do hinges on how well you fight.

battle.speaker: Etzel
battle.line: ...And how am I to fight unarmed, my lord?

battle.speaker: Dactyl
battle.line: Hmm? ...Ah. yes, well, you can have your little book back. But you know what the consequences will be if you betray us...

battle.speaker: Etzel
battle.line: For now, I’ll just have to feign obedience...

boss.speaker: Etzel
boss.line: Sorry. I mean you no harm, but neither have I any wish to die here.

boss.speaker: Dactyl
boss.line: Blast! Where have those indolent guards gone?

end.speaker: Malledus
end.line: Prince Marth! Grust’s garrison left their war chest when they fled. This much gold should buy plenty of equipment. Might I suggest, sire, you avail yourself of this opportunity to outfit your soldiers? Our next opponent will be Grust’s Sable Order. By our scouts’ reports, they march to meet us as we speak. Many say their knights are the strongest on the continent. We’ll want to be well prepared.

end.speaker: Etzel
end.line: You’re Prince Marth, aren’t you? I wish to thank you.

end.speaker: Etzel
end.line: My name is Etzel. I am a traveling sorcerer. Those Grustian cowards stole a ring from me, and were it not for you, I might never have seen it again.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: The ring must have been very dear to you, then.

end.speaker: Etzel
end.line: It’s all I have to remember my wife by. She got caught in the fighting back when Gra betrayed Altea...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Those were dark days. You have my deepest sympathies; I lost my father in the same battle.

end.speaker: Etzel
end.line: Will there be no end to this bloodshed?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: There will, Etzel. I have sworn to end it; that’s the very reason all of us fight.

end.speaker: Etzel
end.line: And you think you can end it, just like that? From anyone else’s lips that would sound absurdly naive. But I can tell you are sincere. Tell me, Prince, have you any need for an extra... spell slinger? I’ve no taste for war, but I do have a fierce hunger for ending it. Let’s usher in a new era, you and I.
